item.title: NYT Mini Crossword Hints Today—Answers For Tuesday, February 17
item.content:encoded:
The NYT Mini Crossword is a popular, quick-to-complete word game to test yourself daily, but solving some conundrums can prove to be tricky.

If you’ve found yourself stuck on today’s NYT Mini, Insider Gaming has some helpful hints and all the answers for the NYT Mini Crossword on February 17, 2026.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s edition of the NYT Mini Crossword. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How to Play NYT Mini Crossword

The NYT Mini Crossword is available to play on the New York Times Games app or website, but, as of September 2025, a New York Times Game subscription is required.

The NYT Games Subscription is priced at $6.95 per month, but there are introductory offers available for other NYT subscriptions that include games access, which might be worth considering.

Without a Games subscription, access to the NYT Mini Crossword is blocked.

NYT Mini Crossword Clues (Feb. 17)

All the clues provided by the NYT for the Mini Crossword on February 17 are shown below.

Across

1 – Prefix meaning “eight.”

5 – Classic poem that begins “I saw the best minds of my generation destroyed by madness.”

6 – One of the Jenners

7 – As one word: A henchman/As two words: “Please proceed.”

8 – Prickly seedcases.

Down

1 – “Stop, I’m blushing!”

2 – Indicator of difficulty in Connections

3 – Identical siblings.

4 – Repeated cheer at a soccer stadium.

6 – Soviet spy org.

Additional Clues for NYT Mini

If you’re still struggling for the answers, here are some additional clues to help complete the NYT Mini Crossword on February 17.

Across

1 – First part of the name of an eight-legged sea creature.

5 – Noise wolves make at the moon.

6 – ___ Minogue, Australian Pop Star.

7 – A stupid, foolish, or eccentric person.

8 – 4 letter anagram created from ‘RUBS’

Down

1 – A mock reprimand for charming or cheeky behaviour.

2 – Shades found in rainbows.

3 – Minneapolis Baseball team.

4 – Shout at a bullfighter.

6 – Le Carre trilogy adversary.

All NYT Mini Crossword Answers (Feb. 17)

If you want to check your answers before submitting, or have given up on working some of them out, all of the answers for the February 17 NYT Mini Crossword are below.

Across

1 – OCTO

5 – HOWL

6 – KYLIE

7 – GOON

8 – BURS

Down

1 – OHYOU

2 – COLOR

3 – TWINS

4 – OLE

6 – KGB

When is The Next Game?

The NYT Mini Crossword refreshes daily at 10 PM ET on weekdays and Saturdays, and at 6 PM ET on Sundays.

As such, the next NYT Mini Crossword will be available at 7 PM PT/9 PM CT/10 PM ET/3 AM GMT/2 PM AET.

What is The NYT Mini Crossword?

The NYT Mini Crossword was introduced in 2014 as a shorter and quicker-to-complete game to accompany the main New York Times Crossword, which was initially released in 1942.

Until September 2025, the NYT Mini Crossword was free, but it has now been consolidated into a monthly NYT Games Subscription alongside several other popular games.

Did you struggle with the NYT Mini Crossword today? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more word game guides, check out the hints and answers for today’s Wordle, and take a look at hints for NYT Connections.

item.title: Today’s Contexto #1248: Hints & Answer For February 17, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Contexto is a word association game that gives you a new word to guess every single day. With every attempt, the AI algorithm determines how close your guess is to the daily answer based on thematic and contextual similarity.

Sometimes, though, no matter how experienced you are, the word you’re looking for can be incredibly vague and hard to deduce. Luckily for you, this guide is full of hints to give you a helping hand, but make sure you give today’s Contexto a go if you haven’t already!

How To Play Contexto

Contexto is incredibly simple to play, but difficult to master. All you have to do is type words into the search bar, and the AI algorithm will tell you how close your word is to the answer.

You’ll know how close your guess is based on the colour of the bar and the number next to it.

  • Red includes guesses with the number 1,501 and above, meaning you’re way off from the secret word.
  • Orange includes guesses between 301 and 1,500, meaning you’re getting closer, but still some ways off.
  • Green includes guesses between 1 and 300, meaning you’re on the right track.

Best Contexto Tips & Tricks

  • Start off using broad terms, then narrow down once you’ve got under the 1,000 mark.
  • Try using Nouns first, and dip into verbs or adjectives once you’ve discovered the context.
  • Experiment with random words at times, especially as different forms of a root word can rank differently, such as work and worker.
  • Guess away, as unlike other word games like Wordle, you aren’t limited to a strict number of attempts.

Best Starting Words For Contexto

Here are some great starting words to get you going with Contexto:

  • Thing
  • Person
  • Place
  • Animal
  • Work
  • Nature
  • Game
  • Concept
  • Idea
  • Food

Contexto Hints For Today, February 17, 2026

Without giving away today’s Contexto answer, here are a few helpful hints to get you thinking in the right direction:

  • Hint 1: High in the sky
  • Hint 2: A Celestial event
  • Hint 3: Lunar activity

If they don’t help, then here are the nine closest words, going from tenth to second:

  • Sun
  • Transit
  • Venus
  • Solstice
  • Saturn
  • Twilight
  • Solar
  • Lunar
  • Moon

Today’s Contexto Answer For Game #1248 On February 17, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, and still can’t figure out today’s Contexto answer, then you can find it down below:

Answer: Eclipse

An occasion when the Sun disappears from view, while the Moon is moving between it and Earth.

When Is The Next Contexto Game After #1248?

Contexto is updated daily at 12 AM or Midnight in your respective time zone, meaning the next game will start on February 18.

The Contexto schedule is very consistent, with a new game releasing at the same time every day.

How did you find today’s Contexto? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For more daily guides, check out IG’s other word game guides:

  • NYT Connections
  • Wordle

item.title: Is The Vampire Diaries Coming To Fortnite? Crossover Rumor, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Another Fortnite crossover is in the rumor mill, and it’s The Vampire Diaries. The show was a teenage dream with spectacular-looking humans (and vampires), captivating audiences for eight seasons.

It’s conceivable that every franchise in gaming, TV, and movie history could arrive in Fortnite. That said, a The Vampire Diaries crossover would’ve been quite low down the Fortnite crossover list. Let’s see if there’s any bite to the rumor.

Will The Vampire Diaries Come To Fortnite?

A Fortnite and Vampire Diaries crossover is a rumor and nothing more right now, and it appears to be one source claiming that it’s happening.

It’s incredible how quickly speculation can spread like wildfire. There are many leakers in the world of Fortnite, but even the major ones, for the time being—haven’t outed a The Vampire Diaries and Fortnite crossover.

  • More Insider Gaming: All Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1 Week 11 Quests & How To Complete Them (February 12)

Does this mean it’s not happening? Nope, but the evidence isn’t strong enough to confirm the fascinating collaboration.

What Is The Fortnite & The Vampire Diaries Rumor?

Content creator Incitable posted to Facebook on February 16 saying: “FORTNITE x VAMPIRE DIARIES is COMING!”

Arguably, the biggest sources for Fortnite rumors and leaks are Shiina and HYPEX, neither of which has said The Vampire Diaries is coming to Fortnite; this could be significant.

  • More Insider Gaming: Fortnite Has A Kingdom Hearts Collab in Development, It’s Claimed

HYPEX has even outed lots of upcoming crossover leaks, but it doesn’t mention anything about vampires.

Incitable says a lot of The Vampire Diaries content is on the way, including Damon Salvatore and Stefan Salvatore skins:

“Damon and Stefan Salvatore are officially coming to Fortnite as part of the Fortnitemares update scheduled for Fortnitemares 2026. It was heavily rumored collab, but has seemed to gain traction and it is in the works along with the Twilight collab which many players are hyped for!”

The crossover could happen, and it might be confirmed sooner rather than later. Until it is, take the news with a pinch of salt, as no one can confirm if the image is real.

If you know more about The Vampire Diaries coming to Epic’s shooter, please reach out to Insider Gaming. Furthermore, if you want to keep up with the latest IG content or chat with the community, make sure to check out the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For now, read about the Honkai: Star Rail and Fortnite collab.

item.title: Assassin’s Creed Shadows Update Finally Lets You… Jump?
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft isn’t finished with Assassin’s Creed Shadows, which dropped last year to a positive reception and a few controversies, particularly those concerning historical inaccuracies. It became a talking point within the Japanese government, amongst other things, which was pretty insane to see.

Tomorrow, February 17, Ubisoft will release title update 1.1.8 for Assassin’s Creed Shadows, kick-starting a special, limited-time parkour challenge, and adding a feature that many think should have been there the entire time.

Yes, that’s the ability to jump.

Manual Jump Coming to Assassin’s Creed Shadows

Forced automatic parkour will be a thing of the past in Assassin’s Creed Shadows with update 1.1.8. Ubisoft is encouraging those still playing the game to participate in a social-driven parkour challenge, creating an unedited shot that they can share to showcase their freerunning abilities in Feudal Japan.

There are prizes up for grabs, but only the cleanest routes will be in with a chance of winning.

To facilitate the challenge, Ubisoft has added manual jumping to Assassin’s Creed Shadows. That now means that, at the press of a button, you can jump. How’s about that for an update?

If you want to enable manual jumping, you’ll need to hop into Advanced Options in the gameplay settings menu and switch the feature on. Otherwise, you’ll still be locked in a creative box by automatic parkour.

Elsewhere, Ubisoft is adding a detailed statistics page and new ‘visual feedback’ for crit hits landed in combat.

Next month, Claws of Awaji, the game’s major expansion, will be released on Nintendo Switch 2. Then, on March 20, the game’s first anniversary rolls around, and Ubisoft has promised something of a small celebration.

Tomorrow’s update will drop at 14:00 UTC and will measure up to 15.77 GB for Xbox users, and as little as 1.7 GB for PS5 users.

Are you looking forward to making some sweet parkour content in Assassin’s Creed Shadows with manual jumping? Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Call of Duty Warzone is going offline

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

More from Grant Taylor-Hill
